item.title: bRACKET
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Mod Life, post:7, topic:288666”]2 new errors but u fixed that problem…
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 13, 2009, 10:51:59 pm[/size][hr]

thats the 2 new errors…[/quote]
You don’t have a file called “ControlPanel” in your server directory, did you add that from a tutorial? if you did, be sure to add the, ControlPanel.java file to your server’s directory.

Where ever controlPanel = new ControlPanel();

replace it with this:

ControlPanel controlPanel = new ControlPanel();

Read full topic

item.title: bRACKET
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

} public void gfx(int id1) { stillgfx(id1, absY, absX; } public void resetGFX(int id, int X, int Y) { GraphicsHandler.removeGFX(id, X, Y); firingspell = false; cast = false; fired = false; }

replace that with

} public void gfx(int id1) { stillgfx(id1, absY, absX); } public void resetGFX(int id, int X, int Y) { GraphicsHandler.removeGFX(id, X, Y); firingspell = false; cast = false; fired = false; }

item.title: bRACKET

item.description:

my code is

} public void gfx(int id1) { stillgfx(id1, absY, absX; } public void resetGFX(int id, int X, int Y) { GraphicsHandler.removeGFX(id, X, Y); firingspell = false; cast = false; fired = false; }

the ^ is supposed to be under the ;

item.description:

public void resetGFX(int id, int X, int Y) { GraphicsHandler.removeGFX(id, X, Y); firingspell = false; cast = false; fired = false; public void gfx(int id1) { stillgfx(id1, absY, absX); }
